summary: The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services estimates that about $16 billion or nearly 10% of its payments to Medicare Advantage organizations were improper. In this testimony, we reviewed several problems we have found with CMS's efforts to ensure proper payments in this program that serves about a third of Medicare beneficiaries. For example, certain CMS audits do not target Medicare Advantage contracts at highest...
title: Medicare Advantage Program Integrity: CMS's Efforts to Ensure Proper Payments and Identify and Recover Improper Payments
